# addDestination(withName:at:)

**Instance Method**

Creates a named destination point in the current PDF page.

## Declaration

```swift
func addDestination(withName name: String, at point: CGPoint)
```

## Parameters

- **name**: The name of the destination, used as a reference by the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIGraphicsPDFRendererContext/setDestinationWithName(_:for:)] method.
- **point**: The location of the destination point, in the PDF coordinate space.

## Discussion

Use this method in conjunction with the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIGraphicsPDFRendererContext/setDestinationWithName(_:for:)] method to create internal links within a PDF. This method represents the creation of the points to which the PDF viewer will jump when a user clicks a link.



For an example of how to use internal links, including mapping between coordinate spaces, see  [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIGraphicsPDFRenderer#Creating-internal-links] in [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIGraphicsPDFRenderer].

## Managing destinations

- **setDestinationWithName(_:for:)**: Creates a link rectangle in the current page that jumps the PDF viewer to the named destination when clicked.
- **setURL(_:for:)**: Creates a link to an external resource defined by a URL
